Video Details

The Video Detail page consists of

  • Toolbar Buttons
  • Preview Player & Cue Points
  • Video Details

Toolbar Buttons

Capture new images
  1. Use the preview player at the top of the page to play the video.
  2. Pause the video when you get to the frame you want to use for the poster/thumbnail image.
  3. Click Capture.
  4. Select to use the image as the poster and/or thumbnail image.
  5. Click Save.
Show me how Details
Add a video to a folder
  1. Select one or more videos and then click More > Move to Folder.
Show me how
Add videos to a manual playlist
  1. Select one or more videos.
  2. Click More > Add to Playlist.
  3. Click on a playlist name.
  4. Click .
Publish videos
  1. Select a video.
  2. Click .
  3. Select a player.
  4. Click the preview link or copy the embed code.
Show me how
Details
Activate / Deactivate a video
  1. Select one or more videos.
  2. Click More > Activate or Deactivate.
Delete videos
  1. Click .

Preview Player & Cue Points

Preview the video
  1. Click the play button to preview the video.
Add a cue point
  1. Play the video.
  2. Click .
  3. Select a Type.
  4. Click .
Details

Video Details

The video details are organized into sections. Click Edit or double-click in a section. Some sections allow the details to be edited directly. Click Save to save the changes. Sections without a Save button will autosave when tabbing out of the field.

Video Information

Contains basic information about a video.

  • Name - Max 255 characters
  • ID - System assigned video ID (unique across all Brightcove accounts)
  • Short description - Max 250 characters
  • Tags - One or more tags, separated by commas. You can use tags to add videos to smart playlists. Max 128 characters.
  • Reference ID - A unique ID assigned by a publisher; max 150 characters
  • Video Projection - Indicates how the video was recorded
  • Enable offline playback - When checked, enables the video to be saved locally and viewed offline
  • Related Link URL - A standard web URL beginning with http:// or https:// limited to 255 characters
  • Related Link Text - Related link text limited to 255 characters
  • Long Description - Max 5000 characters
  • Advertising
    • Free - Ads will not be shown when the video plays
    • Ad Supported - Ads may be shown when video plays
  • Ad Keys - Passed as part of the ad server URL
  • Sharing - Indicates if the video has been shared to another account
Details
Images
  • Displays the images for the video
  • Poster and thumbnail images are created automatically; you can capture new images or upload other images
  • Wide, Portrait and Ultra Wide images must be manually uploaded
  • Hover over any image and click to open the image in a new browser tab
Cast
  • Used to add cast information for a video
  • All fields support type-ahead search; as you type, previous matching entries will appear and can be clicked on to add them to the selection
Custom Fields
  • Used to view and edit the custom field for the video
  • An asterisk (*) next to the field name indicates that the field is required
Details
Text Tracks
  • Used to add text tracks to the video
Details
Audio Tracks
  • Displays information on the audio renditions that are available
Details
Video Type Information
  • The Video Type determines additional video details that are available to be configured
    • Movie - Indicates the video is a movie. When a new video is uploaded, the Video Type will be set to Movie.
    • Episode - Indicates the video is an episode as part of a season. The Video Information panel will display the episode number and the season the video is assigned to.
    • Trailer - Indicates the video is used as a trailer. Videos that are added as a trailer for a movie or episode will automatically have their Video Type changed to Trailer.
Categorization

The Categorization section is used to configure:

  • Genres - Genres the video is associated with
  • Manual Playlists - Playlists that this video belongs to; for more information, see Creating and Managing Playlists
  • Folder - Folder the video is assigned to; see Organizing Videos Using Folders for more information
Availability
  • Used to control the dates and times that a video can be viewed
  • Geo filtering can be used to control which countries have the ability to view the video
Details
Video Files
  • Displays the source file name, the transcoding technology that was used and details on the video renditions that were created
  • Also provides the ability to:
    • Replace the Video Source File
    • Retranscode the Video
